law_name: THE STOCK EXCHANGES (CORPORATISATION, DEMUTUALIZATION AND INTEGRATION) ACT

sections.body: (1) This Act may be called the Stock Exchanges (Corporatisation, Demutualization and Integration) Act, 2012. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once.

(1) In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the context or subject, various definitions are provided for terms such as 'assets', 'blocked account', 'CDC', 'Commission', 'Committee', 'Companies Ordinance', 'Connected Person', 'corporatisation', 'date of corporatisation', 'date of demutualization', 'demutualization', 'financial institution', 'first directors', 'initial shareholders', 'integration', 'liabilities', 'member', 'prescribe or prescribed', 'scheme of integration', 'Securities Ordinance', 'security', 'shareholders', 'stakeholders', 'stock exchange', 'strategic investor', 'substantial shareholder', 'trading right entitlement certificate or TRE certificate', 'trading right entitlement certificate holder or TRE certificate holder', and 'undertaking'. (2) The words and expressions used, but not defined in this Act, but which are defined in the Companies Ordinance or the Securities Ordinance shall have the same meaning as are assigned to them in these Ordinances.

(1) The members of a stock exchange shall not later than thirty days from the commencement of this Act, in a meeting of the stock exchange, ratify the creation and constitution of the demutualization committee existing at such commencement. (2) The committee shall be fully authorized to approve the valuation of the stock exchange to be undertaken by the investment bank, enter into negotiations and finalize the sale of not more than forty per cent of the total issued share capital out of the shares lying in the blocked account with any one or more strategic investors or financial institutions, and determine the offer price for offer for sale of shares to general public.

sections.section_title: Submission of information by the stock exchange.
sections.body: (1) Within forty-five days of the commencement of this Act, each stock exchange shall submit to the Commission various required documents including a valuation of the stock exchange approved by the committee, a re-valuation of the assets and liabilities, the proposed authorized and paid-up capital, the names of initial shareholders, the proposed plan for segregation of functions, and a detailed five year development plan.
